user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of MHD_queue_auth_required_response3:
```c
_MHD_EXTERN enum MHD_Result
MHD_queue_auth_required_response3 (struct MHD_Connection *connection,
                                   const char *realm,
                                   const char *opaque,
                                   const char *domain,
                                   struct MHD_Response *response,
                                   int signal_stale,
                                   enum MHD_DigestAuthMultiQOP mqop,
                                   enum MHD_DigestAuthMultiAlgo3 malgo3,
                                   int userhash_support,
                                   int prefer_utf8)
{
  struct DigestAlgorithm da;
  char *buf_ptr;
  enum MHD_Result ret;

  buf_ptr = NULL;
  digest_setup_zero (&da);
  ret = queue_auth_required_response3_inner (connection,
                                             realm,
                                             opaque,
                                             domain,
                                             response,
                                             signal_stale,
                                             mqop,
                                             malgo3,
                                             userhash_support,
                                             prefer_utf8,
                                             &buf_ptr,
                                             &da);
  digest_deinit (&da);
  if (NULL != buf_ptr)
    free (buf_ptr);
  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: No unreachable code detected. The function contains a straight-line control flow: declarations, buf_ptr initialization, digest_setup_zero(&da), a call to queue_auth_required_response3_inner that returns into ret, digest_deinit(&da), an if (NULL != buf_ptr) free(buf_ptr), and return ret. There are no constant-condition branches, no unconditional returns/gotos/loops that would skip subsequent statements, and no code following an unconditional transfer-of-control. The conditional free is reachable depending on buf_ptr set by the inner call. Although the inner function could hypothetically perform a non-local exit (e.g., longjmp or abort), such behavior is not visible in this source and does not create statically unreachable code in this function. Therefore no fragments need investigation for MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1.
